com.orchestranetworks.schema
Interface SchemaNode

public interface SchemaNode

Represents an element declaration in the resolved data model.

Method Summary

Method Detail

getMinOccurs

public int getMinOccurs()
Returns the value of xs:minOccurs.

getMaxOccurs

public int getMaxOccurs()
Returns the value of xs:maxOccurs.

getPathInAdaptation

public Path getPathInAdaptation()
Returns the local absolute path.

In a table record, the local absolute path is the path that begins at the table root node (non-inclusive); otherwise, it is the path that starts at the data set root node (inclusive). In the latter case, the path is the same as the one returned by getPathInSchema().

See Also:
getPathInSchema()

getPathInSchema

public Path getPathInSchema()
Returns the full absolute path of this node in the data model.

See Also:
getPathInAdaptation()

isComplex

public boolean isComplex()
Returns true if this node is a complex element declaration.

isValueEqual

public boolean isValueEqual(Object aFirstValue,
                            Object aSecondValue)
Returns true if the specified values are equal, according to the underlying XML Schema type.

For example, if the data model type is xs:date, both specified values must instances of Date. Also, equality checking for xs:date does not take time into account, due to the Java equality checking for Date. In contrast, equality checking for the type xs:dateTime in the data model would compare time.

Throws:
ClassCastException - if a specified value is not an instance of the underlying type.

isValueLessOrEqualTo

public boolean isValueLessOrEqualTo(Object aFirstValue,
                                    Object aSecondValue)
Returns true if first value is less than or equal to the second value, according to the underlying XML Schema type.

Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if underlying type does not support comparison.
ClassCastException - if a specified value is not an instance of underlying type.

isValueStrictlyLessThan

public boolean isValueStrictlyLessThan(Object aFirstValue,
                                       Object aSecondValue)
Returns true if the first value is strictly less than the second value, according to the underlying XML Schema type.

Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the underlying type does not support comparison.
ClassCastException - if a specified value is not an instance of the underlying type.

isTerminalValue

public boolean isTerminalValue()
Returns true if this node is terminal.

A node is terminal when:

  • it is of a simple type and it is not the descendant of a terminal complex (see isTerminalValueDescendant());
  • it is a complex node and the data model specifies any of the following:
    1. maxOccurs > 1 (it is either an aggregated list or a osd:table);
    2. a value function, osd:function (see Computed Values);
    3. an access property, osd:access (see Access Properties).

Note: if inheritance is enabled, a terminal node value can be inherited.

See Also:
isTerminalValueDescendant()

isTerminalValueDescendant

public boolean isTerminalValueDescendant()
Returns true if this node is the descendant of a terminal value node.

See Also:
isTerminalValue()

isTerminalValueComputed

public boolean isTerminalValueComputed()
Returns true if this node is a terminal node whose value is not directly stored in EBX5 repository.

This is the case for a node declaring an osd:function, an osd:select, or an osd:table.

isAutoIncrement

public boolean isAutoIncrement()
Returns true if this node defines an auto-increment.

An auto-incremented node is specified in the data model by means of the osd:autoIncrement extension.

isSelectNode

public boolean isSelectNode()
Returns true if this node is a selection link.

A select node is specified in the data model by means of osd:select extension.

See Also:
getSelectionLink()

getSelectionLink

public SelectionLink getSelectionLink()
Returns the information about a selection link. Returns null if the node has no selection link defined.

See Also:
isSelectNode()

getTableNode

public SchemaNode getTableNode()
If this node is in a table record, returns the table node that defines osd:table.

Returns:
either the table node that holds the osd:table declaration, or null if this node is not inside a table.
See Also:
isTableNode(), getTableOccurrenceRootNode()

isTableNode

public boolean isTableNode()
Returns true if this node is a table node.

A table node is specified in the data model by means of osd:table declaration (see Table definition).

See Also:
getTableOccurrenceRootNode()

getTablePrimaryKeyNodes

public SchemaNode[] getTablePrimaryKeyNodes()
Returns the primary key that is defined in the data model if this node is a table node.

Returns:
either the nodes of the primary key that is specified by the osd:table/primaryKeys declaration (in the same order), or null if this node is not a table node.
See Also:
getTableNode(), isTableNode(), getTableOccurrenceRootNode(), AdaptationTable.computePrimaryKey(Object[]), AdaptationTable.computePrimaryKey(Adaptation), AdaptationTable.computePrimaryKey(ValueContext)

getTablePrimaryKeyValues

public Object[] getTablePrimaryKeyValues(String aTableRefValue)
                                  throws InvalidPrimaryKeyException,
                                         IllegalArgumentException
If this node is a table node, decomposes the specified osd:tableRef value into the primary key field(s) value(s) it would have in the table.

The following table gives some examples of decomposition:

Key fields String representation (aTableRefValue) returns
(xs:string) "abc" "abc"
(xs:int) "123" [Integer(123)]
(xs:int) "" throws an InvalidPrimaryKeyException.
(xs:int) "aa" throws an InvalidPrimaryKeyException.
(xs:int | xs:string) "123|abc" [Integer(123), "abc"]
(xs:int | xs:string) "123|abc|abc" [Integer(123), "abc|abc"] (the second field is itself a foreign key, the second value can hence be itself decomposed)
(xs:int | xs:string) "aa|aaa" (invalid integer field) throws an InvalidPrimaryKeyException.
(xs:int | xs:string) "|aaa" throws an InvalidPrimaryKeyException.
(xs:int | xs:string) "" (empty string) throws an InvalidPrimaryKeyException.
(xs:int | xs:string) "aaa" Invalid, throws an InvalidPrimaryKeyException.

Parameters:
aTableRefValue - a string value conforming to primary key syntax.
Returns:
an array whose each element is extracted from the specified value and that corresponds to the field at the same position in the primary key fields array.
Throws:
InvalidPrimaryKeyException - if the specified value has not the expected primary key syntax, or if one field value is null.
IllegalStateException - if this node is not a table node.
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified value is null.
Since:
5.2.3
See Also:
getTablePrimaryKeyNodes(), PrimaryKey syntax, SchemaFacetTableRef.getTablePrimaryKeyValues(String)

getTablePrimaryKeyValues

public Object[] getTablePrimaryKeyValues(PrimaryKey aPrimaryKey)
                                  throws InvalidPrimaryKeyException,
                                         IllegalArgumentException
If this node is a table node, decomposes the specified primary key object into the primary key field(s) value(s) it would have in the table.

This method is equivalent to:

this.getTablePrimaryKeyValues(aPrimaryKey.format());

Throws:
InvalidPrimaryKeyException
IllegalArgumentException
See Also:
getTablePrimaryKeyValues(String)

getTableOccurrenceRootNode

public SchemaNode getTableOccurrenceRootNode()
For a table node (see method isTableNode()), returns the root node of the records' structure.

This method is needed for accessing the internal structure of a table.

Explanation: Since a table node is considered as a terminal node, it does not provide direct access to the table node children. Instead, those children can only be accessed through the root node of the records' structure (the object returned by this method).

Returns:
null if this node is not a table node, the root node of the records' structure otherwise.
See Also:
isTableNode()

isTableOccurrenceNode

public boolean isTableOccurrenceNode()
Returns true if this node is in a table record.

getAccessMode

public AccessPermission getAccessMode()
Returns the static access mode of the current node. Access can be further restricted by specifying permissions.

For example, a function is read-only.

Note that if the node is neither terminal nor terminal descendant, the returned mode is hidden: this is somewhat confusing since this does not imply that the node is not seen, but only that it does not directly hold a value.

See Also:
Access Properties, isTerminalValue()

getCategory

public String getCategory()
Returns the category that is defined in data model (attribute osd:category). Returns null if no category is specified neither on the current node nor on its ancestors.

getDefaultValue

public Object getDefaultValue()
Returns the default value that is defined in data model (attribute xs:default), or null if no value is specified.

This default value is typed according to type of the current node. That is, the default value specified in the data model must comply with the type of the associated element.

If the current node is an aggregated list (an element defining maxOccurs>1) then the returned default value will be a new List instance containing a single occurrence of the default value defined in the data model.

getLabel

public String getLabel(Locale aLocale)
Returns the localized label of this node.

The label is computed as follows:

  1. If the data model defines a custom SchemaDocumentation, then the computed label is returned if it is not null;
  2. Otherwise, the label that is defined statically on the current node in the data model is returned;
  3. If no static label is defined, the name of this node is returned (the name is the last part of the node's path).

See Also:
getLabel(Session)

getDescription

public String getDescription(Locale aLocale)
Returns the localized description of this node.

The description is computed as follows:

  1. If the data model defines a custom SchemaDocumentation, then the computed description is returned if it is not null;
  2. Otherwise, the description that is defined statically on the current node in the data model is returned.

See Also:
getDescription(Session)

getLabel

public String getLabel(Session aSession)
Returns the label of this node for the specified session.

The label is computed as follows:

  1. If the data model defines a custom SchemaDocumentation, then the computed label is returned if it is not null;
  2. Otherwise, the label that is defined statically on the current node in the data model is returned;
  3. If no static label is defined, the name of this node is returned (the name is the last part of the node's path).

See Also:
getLabel(Locale), SchemaDocumentation.getLabel(SchemaDocumentationContext)

getDescription

public String getDescription(Session aSession)
Returns the localized description of this node in the context of a user session.

The description is computed as follows:

  1. If the data model defines a custom SchemaDocumentation, then the computed description is returned if it is not null;
  2. Otherwise, the description that is defined statically on the current node in the data model is returned.

See Also:
getDescription(Locale), SchemaDocumentation.getDescription(SchemaDocumentationContext)

getMandatoryUserMessage

public UserMessage getMandatoryUserMessage()
Returns the mandatory error message (defined by data model element osd:mandatoryErrorMessage).

getNode

public SchemaNode getNode(Path aPath)
Returns the node at the specified path, or null if no node exists at the specified path.

If the path is relative, it is interpreted regarding this node location. This method is equivalent to getNode(aPath, true, false).

If the path begins with //, then the first node that matches what follows is returned (note that this syntax is not so efficient as absolute or relative notations).

See Also:
getPathInSchema()

getNode

public SchemaNode getNode(Path aPath,
                          boolean tolerantRead,
                          boolean absolutePathBeginsAtRecordRoot)
                   throws PathAccessException
Returns the node at the specified path, or null if it does not exist and isTolerantRead is true.

Parameters:
aPath - if relative, it is interpreted regarding this node location.
tolerantRead - if true, returns null when no node exists at the specified location; otherwise it throws PathAccessException.
absolutePathBeginsAtRecordRoot - if true and aPath is absolute and this node is in a table, then the path root is the table root node.
Throws:
PathAccessException - if no node exists at the specified path and isTolerantRead is false.

getNodeChildren

public SchemaNode[] getNodeChildren()
Returns the data model nodes defined directly under this node.

This method returns an empty array if the underlying type is a simple type or if it is a table node (see isTableNode(); in order to get the structure of the table, it is necessary to use the method getTableOccurrenceRootNode()).

Note that a node can have children and also be considered as "terminal" in the meaning given by the method isTerminalValue().

getSchemaLocation

public SchemaLocation getSchemaLocation()
Returns the location of the data model that defines this node.

getSchemaDefaultLocale

public Locale getSchemaDefaultLocale()
Returns the default locale of the data model.

The default locale of a data model is defined in its module declaration (file /WEB-INF/ebx/module.xml).

getSchemaLocales

public List getSchemaLocales()
Returns the locales supported by the data model.

The locales supported by a data model are defined in its module declaration (file /WEB-INF/ebx/module.xml).

The returned list is not modifiable.

getXsTypeName

public SchemaTypeName getXsTypeName()
Returns the type name of this node, or null if this node is associated with an anonymous type definition.

displayOccurrence

public String displayOccurrence(Object aValue,
                                boolean useLabels,
                                ValueContext aValueContext,
                                Locale aLocale)
Returns a user-friendly representation of the specified value.

Value display:

A value can have a display that is different from the standard XML formatted value (see method formatToXsString):

  1. Numbers and dates formats: If the element is a number (xs:int, xs:decimal, etc.), or a date (xs:date, xs:dateTime, xs:time), it is formatted according to the formatting policy associated with the specified locale.
  2. Value labeling: If useLabels is true and element has a declaration that enables value labeling, as summarized in the table below.
Data model definition Value labeling (if useLabels = true)
xs:enumeration Label is either the value of the attribute osd:label or the content of the possibly localized element xs:documentation, specified in the data model.
osd:tableRef For a foreign key constraint, the label is computed from the referenced record if it exists and the data model declaration: in preference order, osd:tableRef/display or osd:table/defaultLabel; if there is no such declaration, the label is the concatenation of the label of each primary key fields of the referenced record.
osd:enumeration For a dynamic enumeration, the label comes from the target node, if it defines such labels.
osd:constraintEnumeration For a programmatic enumeration constraint, the label is the string returned by the method ConstraintEnumeration.displayOccurrence. As a consequence, it may be localized.
osd:constraintNomenclature For a programmatic nomenclature constraint, the label is the string returned by the method NomenclatureItem.getLabel, if the nomenclature item exists for the specified value.
other cases No value labeling is performed, the method returns the formatted value.

Contexts' limitations:

If the specified ValueContext is retrieved on ProcedureContext this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException when dynamic or programmatic labeling involves a call to ValueContext.getValue(Path) with a relative path.

Parameters:
aValue - The value must be compatible with the current node's type. If the current node has its maxOccurs > 1, then the value must be an element of the List instance, not the List itself.
useLabels - If true and labeling is enabled, specifies that the label associated with the value must be returned. See the table above.
aValueContext - Context holding the value. It is used when the label to be returned depends on a contextual and dynamic resolution based on a relative path (see above).
aLocale - Locale for formatting numbers, dates or for getting localized labels (if enabled).
See Also:
getEnumerationList(ValueContext), getEnumerationNomenclature(ValueContext)

formatToXsString

public String formatToXsString(Object aValue)
Returns the string that corresponds to the specified value. This method uses the underlying XML Schema type for performing the Object-to-String conversion.

For example, if the underlying type is xs:date, the specified record must be a Date instance and this method will return the XML Schema representation of this date.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the resulting string is not a valid XML string (this happens if a specified xs:string contains invalid XML characters).
ClassCastException - if the value is not of the expected Java type.
See Also:
parseXsString(String)

parseXsString

public Object parseXsString(String aString)
                     throws ConversionException
Returns the value that corresponds to the specified string. This method uses the underlying XML Schema type for performing the String-to-Object conversion.

For example, if the underlying type is xs:date, the string must conform to the XML Schema representation of dates (for example "1999-05-31") and this method returns a Date instance.

Throws:
ConversionException - if specified string is not correct regarding the underlying XML Schema type.
See Also:
formatToXsString(Object)

getOccurrencesJavaClass

public Class getOccurrencesJavaClass()
Returns the default Class of the Java records of this data model node, null if this node is above a terminal node.

See Also:
isTerminalValue()

createNewOccurrence

public Object createNewOccurrence()
Creates a new Java object that depends on this node definition.

The returned value is in conformity with the following rules:

  • If the element declaration has maxOccurs > 1, it does not take this fact into account (that is, it returns an element of the List, not a List instance).
  • If the element is of a simple type and no default value is defined, it returns null.
  • If the element is of a simple type and a default value is defined, it returns this default value (a clone of it, if this is a mutable object).
  • If element is of a complex type, it returns a new instance, either of the class specified in osd:class="" attribute, or of a default internal class (such an instance may be accessed by executeRead(Object)).

executeRead

public Object executeRead(Object aContainerRecord)
For a sub-terminal node, reads a record of the parent node so as to return the value corresponding to this node.

Use example

The parent node has maxOccurs > 1 and it refers to a complex content. Hence, the parent value will be a Java List. For each object ("record") in the list, this method is able to get the value that is associated with this child node.

Precondition

The parent element must be a terminal value (see isTerminalValue()) or the descendant of a terminal value.

Parameters:
aContainerRecord - must be a record, according to the data model definition of the parent node.

getFacets

public Iterator getFacets()
Returns an iterator over the facets defined by this data model node.

This method can be used to retrieve all facets of a kind. That is for example it is possible using this method to get both static and dynamic length facets held by this node.

See Also:
SchemaFacet

getFacetLength

public SchemaFacetLength getFacetLength()
Returns the first length facet held by this node. Returns null if the node has no length facet defined.

If several length facets are defined the method getFacets() can be called instead.

See Also:
SchemaFacetLength

If several maxlength facets are defined the method getFacets() can be called instead.

If several fractionDigits facets are defined the method getFacets() can be called instead.

See Also:
SchemaFacetFractionDigits

getFacetOnTableReference

public SchemaFacetTableRef getFacetOnTableReference()
Returns the osd:tableRef facet (foreign key constraint) held by this node. Returns null if the node has no foreign key constraint or if it has errors in the case of non-existent container data set or data space.

getFacetOResource

public SchemaFacetOResource getFacetOResource()
Returns the OResource facet held by this node. Returns null if the node has no facet OResource.

See Also:
SchemaFacetOResource

getFacetEnumeration

public SchemaFacetEnumeration getFacetEnumeration()
Returns the first enumeration facet, that is one the following facet: xs:enumeration, osd:tableRef, osd:enumerationosd:constraintEnumeration, or osd:constraintNomenclature. Returns null if the node does not define an enumeration.

See Also:
getEnumerationList(ValueContext), getEnumerationNomenclature(ValueContext)

getEnumerationList

public List getEnumerationList(ValueContext aValueContext)
Returns the values that may be taken by this node, when the data model specifies an enumeration. If no enumeration is specified, this method returns null.

When a value is associated with a label, this label may be displayed by invoking displayOccurrence.

Here are the supported cases:

Data model definition Result
xs:enumeration For a static enumeration, this method returns the list of static objects defined in the data model.
osd:tableRef For a foreign key constraint, this method returns the list of primary keys defined by the target table, in their String representation (see PrimaryKey.format()).
osd:enumeration For a dynamic enumeration, this method returns the list of objects defined by the target node.
osd:constraintEnumeration For a programmatic enumeration constraint, this method returns the list of objects as returned by ConstraintEnumeration.getValues(ValueContext).
osd:constraintNomenclature For a programmatic nomenclature constraint, this method returns the list of the values of the nomenclature returned by ConstraintNomenclature.getNomenclature(ValueContext).
other cases This method returns null.

Parameters:
aValueContext - Context holding the enumeration, it is used when the enumeration to be returned depends on a contextual and dynamic resolution.
Returns:
see table above.
See Also:
displayOccurrence(Object, boolean, ValueContext, Locale), getFacetEnumeration()

getEnumerationNomenclature

public Nomenclature getEnumerationNomenclature(ValueContext aValueContext)
Looks for an underlying Nomenclature. It is searched through facets. If no nomenclature is found, it returns null.

Here are the supported cases:

Data model definition Result
osd:enumeration For a dynamic enumeration whose target node itself has a nomenclature,this method returns the nomenclature corresponding to the values of the target node.
osd:constraintNomenclature For a programmatic nomenclature constraint, this method returns the nomenclature as returned by ConstraintNomenclature.getNomenclature(ValueContext).
other cases This method returns null.

Parameters:
aValueContext - Context holding the nomenclature, it is used when the nomenclature to be returned depends on a contextual and dynamic resolution.
Returns:
see table above.
See Also:
getFacetEnumeration()

isValueFunction

public boolean isValueFunction()
Returns true if this node holds a function.

A function is specified in the data model by means of osd:function extension.

See Also:
ValueFunction

getInformation

public SchemaNodeInformation getInformation()
Returns the additional information defined in the data model for this node (property osd:information).

getInheritanceProperties

public SchemaInheritanceProperties getInheritanceProperties()
Returns the inheritance properties defined in the data model for this node (property osd:inheritance). If no inheritance is specified, this method returns null.
